Package uk.co.spudsoft.params4j

Interface Params4JFactory<P>

Type Parameters:
P - The type of the parameters object.
All Known Implementing Classes:
Params4JFactoryImpl
public interface Params4JFactory<P>
Factory class for creating Params4J instances.
Author:
jtalbut

  • Method Details

    • withConstructor

      Params4JFactory<P> withConstructor(Supplier<P> supplier)
      Configure the constructor to be used by Params4J.

      The supplier should return a newly created instance of the parameters object. The instance can have any default values already set.

      It is permissible to reuse an existing instance, but Params4J will not make any effort to "clear it out", only values set by the gatherers will be altered. This would mean that if a single instance is used and a configuration option is removed that value would retain its previous value.

      Parameters:
      supplier - Supplier of the parameters object that Params4J will set.
      Returns:
      this.

    • withGatherer

      Params4JFactory<P> withGatherer(ParameterGatherer<P> gatherer)
      Base method for configuring Params4J to use a gatherer.

      Gatherers will be processed in the order they are added to the Params4J object.

      Parameters:
      gatherer - The gatherer to use.
      Returns:
      this.

    • withProblemHandler

      Params4JFactory<P> withProblemHandler(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.deser.DeserializationProblemHandler problemHandler)
      Set a custom deserialization problem handler to be used by Jackson.

      Calling this method is optional, the default implementation (DefaultParametersErrorHandler) simply logs any errors (at WARN level) and continues; A single problem handler is used for all gatherers.

      Note that the problem handler is only used when constructing the default mappers, if the default mappers are not used then the object passed in here will not be used.

      Parameters:
      problemHandler - The problem handler to use.
      Returns:
      this.

    • withPropsMapper

      Params4JFactory<P> withPropsMapper(com.fasterxml.jackson.dataformat.javaprop.JavaPropsMapper propsMapper)
      Set a custom Jackson properties mapper.

      Calling this method is optional, if not called the default props mapper is created by Params4JImpl.createPropsMapper. Note that the props mapper is used when processing system properties and environment variables as well as properties files.

      Parameters:
      propsMapper - The props mapper to use.
      Returns:
      this.

    • withJsonMapper

      Params4JFactory<P> withJsonMapper(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper jsonMapper)
      Set a custom Jackson object mapper.

      Calling this method is optional, if not called the default object mapper is created by Params4JImpl.createJsonMapper.

      Parameters:
      jsonMapper - The object mapper to use.
      Returns:
      this.

    • withCustomJsonModule

      Params4JFactory<P> withCustomJsonModule(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.Module module)
      Set a custom Jackson module to use with the default object mapper.

      Calling this method is optional, if not called the default object mapper is created by Params4JImpl#createJsonMapper with no custom modules. Modules will be added in the order that this method is called.

      If a custom object mapper is used (via withJsonMapper(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper)) then this method will not achieve anything.

      Parameters:
      module - The jackson module to add to the default object mapper.
      Returns:
      this.

    • withMixIn

      Params4JFactory<P> withMixIn(Class<?> target, Class<?> mixinSource)
      Adds a custom MixIn class to the default object mapper.

      Calling this method is optional, if not called the default object mapper is created by Params4JImpl#createJsonMapper with no custom MixIns. MixIns will be added in the order that this method is called.

      See ObjectMapper.addMixIn(java.lang.Class, java.lang.Class) for details of MixIns.

      If a custom object mapper is used (via withJsonMapper(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper)) then this method will not achieve anything.

      Parameters:
      target - Class (or interface) whose annotations to effectively override
      mixinSource - Class (or interface) whose annotations are to be "added" to target's annotations, overriding as necessary
      Returns:
      this.

    • withYamlMapper

      Params4JFactory<P> withYamlMapper(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper yamlMapper)
      Set a custom Jackson YAML mapper.

      Calling this method is optional, if not called the default object mapper is created by Params4JImpl.createYamlMapper.

      Note that a YAML mapper is just an instance of ObjectMapper with a YAMLFactory. If an ordinary JSON mapper is passed in to this method it will not parse YAML files correctly.

      Parameters:
      yamlMapper - The object mapper to use for processing YAML files.
      Returns:
      this.

    • withResourceGatherer

      Params4JFactory<P> withResourceGatherer(String resource, FileType fileType)
      Convenience method for adding a ResourceGatherer to the Params4J instance.

      This gatherer does no scanning, it loads the single resource file which must be of the specified type.

      Equivalent to 

       return withGatherer(new ResourceGatherer<>(resource, fileType));
      Parameters:
      resource - The resource to be gathered.
      fileType - The type of file pointed to by the resource.
      Returns:
      this.

    • withDirGatherer

      Params4JFactory<P> withDirGatherer(File dir, FileType... fileTypes)
      Convenience method for adding a DirGatherer to the Params4J instance.

      The DirGatherer scans a directory and gathers values from any files of the specified types. It also configures a monitor for any changes to files in that directory. It does not scan sub directories.

      Equivalent to 

       return withGatherer(new DirGatherer$lt;>(dir, fileTypes));
      Parameters:
      dir - The directory containing files to be gathered.
      fileTypes - The types of files to be checked in the dir.
      Returns:
      this.

    • withEnvironmentVariablesGatherer

      Params4JFactory<P> withEnvironmentVariablesGatherer(String namePrefix, boolean toLowerCase)
      Convenience method for adding an EnvironmentVariablesGatherer to the Params4J instance.

      Note that on Linux (which include docker on Windows) shells usually have constraints on environment variable names. Specifically names can only consist of letters, digits and the underscore. Furthermore lowercase variable names should be used for local variables, not one that are passed between processes.

      Given that params4j expects keys like "prefix.list[1]" this can be a problem. Typically docker and kubernetes do not enforce constraints on the environment variable keys, but if your container uses a shell script to bootstrap your service then it probably is affected.

      This class takes two steps to workaround these limitations: 1. Any underscores in environment variable key names are replaced with a dot ("."). 2. Optionally, all keys can be converted to lower case (using the default locale).

      If this not enough to enable an environment variable to be used for a given value then another approach will have to be found. In particular list values ("list[1]") are not going to work as environment variables if they have to processed by a shell.

      To avoid trying to process all environment variables as parameters the namePrefix can be used to filter environment variables. If the namePrefix is supplied (is not null or empty) only environment variables that begin with the prefix will be considered. The prefix will be removed before mapping variables to the parameters object. The prefix is always considered to have a trailing dot ("."), this does not have to be specified in the namePrefix argument.

      Equivalent to 

       return withGatherer(new EnvironmentVariablesGatherer<>(namePrefix, toLowerCase));
      Parameters:
      namePrefix - The prefix that can be used to filter environment variables.
      toLowerCase - If true all environment variable names will be converted to lower case before passing to Jackson.
      Returns:
      this.

    • withSystemPropertiesGatherer

      Params4JFactory<P> withSystemPropertiesGatherer(String namePrefix)
      Convenience method for adding a SystemPropertiesGatherer to the Params4J instance.

      To avoid trying to process all environment variables as parameters the namePrefix can be used to filter environment variables. If the namePrefix is supplied (is not null or empty) only environment variables that begin with the prefix will be considered. The prefix will be removed before mapping variables to the parameters object. The prefix is always considered to have a trailing dot ("."), this does not have to be specified in the namePrefix argument.

      Equivalent to 

       return withGatherer(new SystemPropertiesGatherer<>(namePrefix));
      Parameters:
      namePrefix - The prefix that can be used to filter environment variables.
      Returns:
      this.

    • withCommandLineArgumentsGatherer

      Params4JFactory<P> withCommandLineArgumentsGatherer(String[] args, String namePrefix)
      Convenience method for adding a CommandLineArgumentsGatherer to the Params4J instance.

      Arguments are parsed by whatever shell is in use and should be escaped appropriately. Each string in the args[] array should be a single key/value pair separated by "=". Any arguments that do not contain the equals character will be treated as being "=true";

      To avoid trying to process all arguments as parameters the namePrefix can be used to filter them. If the namePrefix is supplied (is not null or empty) only command line arguments that begin with the prefix will be considered. The prefix will be removed before mapping variables to the parameters object. The prefix is always considered to have a trailing dot ("."), this does not have to be specified in the namePrefix argument. Use of the namePrefix is less useful on command line arguments than on environment variables or system properties, but it sometimes makes sense to include it for consistency.

      Equivalent to 

       return withGatherer(new CommandLineArgumentsGatherer<>(args, namePrefix));
      Parameters:
      args - The arguments passed in to the main() method.
      namePrefix - The prefix that can be used to filter environment variables.
      Returns:
      this.

    • withSecretsGatherer

      Params4JFactory<P> withSecretsGatherer(Path root, int fileSizeLimit, int fileCountLimit, int fileDepthLimit, Charset charset)
      Convenience method for adding a SecretsGatherer to the Params4J instance.

      The SecretsGatherer scans a directory hierarchy and adds any files found to the parameters. Hidden files and directories (those beginning with a '.') are skipped.

      Note that each entire file is read in as a single parameter value, the files are not parsed.

      This is aimed at allowing the injection of Kubernetes secrets into the parameters object (hence the name) but can used for other purposes.

      The various limit parameters are provided to restrict the time and memory wasted by a bad configuration. In a standard situation the limits should be set to values that are larger than any expected values.

      It also configures a monitor for any changes to files in that directory.

      Equivalent to 

       return withGatherer(new SecretsGatherer$lt;>(root, fileSizeLimit, fileCountLimit, fileDepthLimit, charset));
      Parameters:
      root - The base path from which to start searching, typically something like "/etc/[service name]/conf.d"
      fileSizeLimit - The maximum size of file to attempt to load. The recommendation is to set this to slightly larger than your standard secret length.
      fileCountLimit - The maximum number of files to attempt to load. The recommendation is to set this to one more than the number of secrets in your parameters hierarchy.
      fileDepthLimit - The maximum depth of hierarchy to traverse. The recommendation is to set this to one more than the maximum depth of secrets in your parameters hierarchy.
      charset - The charset to use when reading the file.
      Returns:
      this.

    • create

      Params4J<P> create()
      Factory method for creating a new instance of Params4J<P>.
      Returns:
      a new instance of Params4J<P>
